intro: Tragium cumbrae, commonly known as the mountain ragwort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh climatic conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in clusters. Tragium cumbrae plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a food source for certain herbivores.
